For the purposes of paragraph 76.03(6)(a) of the Special Import Measures Act, the other persons to whom and government to which a notice of the Tribunal’s decision to initiate an expiry review must be sent are the persons — other than the President — to whom and government to which it would be required by rule 55 to send a copy of the notice of commencement of inquiry if the review were an inquiry referred to in rule 53.

Section.Text: In order to decide whether an expiry review under section 76.03 of the Special Import Measures Act is warranted, the Tribunal may request the parties to provide information in relation to the factors prescribed in section 37.2 of the Special Import Measures Regulations and any other matter that is relevant to the review.

If the President determines that the expiry of the order or finding is likely to result in a continuation or resumption of dumping or subsidizing, the President must provide without delay to the Tribunal under subsection 76.03(9) of the Special Import Measures Act the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons for the determination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information relating to the enforcement of the Tribunal’s order or finding and, in particular, to the extent available, the total volume and value of the imports and the volume and value of the dumped or subsidized imports and undumped or unsubsidized imports; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that has been taken into consideration by the President.

Section.Text: If the Tribunal makes an order under subsection 76.03(12) of the Special Import Measures Act, it must cause a notice of it to be published in the Canada Gazette and send a copy of the order and reasons for it to each party as well as to each person who was provided with the notice of the Tribunal’s decision to initiate the expiry review.

Heading.TitleText: Review under Section 76.1 of the Special Import Measures Act

Subsection.Text: If the Minister requests the Tribunal to review an order or a finding under subsection 76.1(1) of the Special Import Measures Act, the Tribunal must publish a notice of review in the Canada Gazette that sets out the information specified in subrule 71(1).

The Tribunal shall send a copy of a notice of review to each person to whom and government to which the Tribunal would be required by rule 55 to send a copy of the notice of commencement of inquiry if the review were an inquiry referred to in rule 53.

Section.Text: If the Tribunal continues or amends an order or a finding under subsection 76.1(2) of the Special Import Measures Act, it must cause a notice of its decision to be published in the Canada Gazette and send a copy of the decision and the reasons for it to each party as well as to each person who was provided with the notice of review.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subrule (2), rules 59 to 61.2 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, to a review under this Part.
Rules 61.1 and 61.2 do not apply to a review under section 76.01, 76.02 or 76.1 of the Special Import Measures Act.

Heading.Label: PART VII
Heading.TitleText: Rulings Under Section 89 and Reconsiderations Under Paragraph 91(1)(g) of the Special Import Measures Act

Section.Text: This Part applies

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a request made to the Tribunal by the President pursuant to section 89 of the Special Import Measures Act for a ruling on the question of which of two or more persons is the importer in Canada of goods imported or to be imported into Canada on which duty is payable or has been paid or will be payable if the goods are imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to a reconsideration, under paragraph 91(1)(g) of that Act, of an order or finding made by the Tribunal in an inquiry referred to in paragraph 90(c) of that Act.

Section.Text: Where the President makes a request pursuant to subsection 89(1) of the Special Import Measures Act, the President

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall give notice of the request to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: each of the two or more persons referred to in that subsection,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the President made the request at the request of a person interested in the importation of the goods referred to in that subsection, that person interested, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: each exporter to Canada of those goods; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall file with the Tribunal a list of the names, addresses for service, telephone numbers and fax numbers, if any, of the persons given notice pursuant to paragraph (a).

Heading.TitleText: Notice of Request for a Ruling

Subsection.Text: Immediately after the list referred to in paragraph 75(b) is filed with the Tribunal, the Tribunal must cause to be published in the Canada Gazette a notice of request for a ruling setting out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statutory authority for the request for a ruling;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the matter or thing that is the subject of the request for a ruling;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which any written submission must be filed with the Tribunal and the number of copies of any written submission that must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: instructions with respect to the filing of confidential information;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the Tribunal has or has not directed that a hearing be held;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the Tribunal has directed that a hearing be held, the following information, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the place and time fixed for commencement of the hearing or, if the place and time have not been fixed, a statement that notice of the place and time fixed for the hearing will be given to any person who files with the Tribunal a written request for such a notice,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on or before which an interested person must file with the Tribunal a notice of participation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on or before which counsel for a person who files a notice of participation must file with the Tribunal a notice of representation and, if appropriate, a declaration and undertaking referred to in subrule 16(1);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the address to which written submissions or correspondence may be sent or delivered and at which information in respect of the request for a ruling may be obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the Tribunal considers relevant to the ruling.

Subsection.Text: The Tribunal shall send a copy of a notice of request for a ruling to the following persons:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the President; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each person shown on the list referred to in paragraph 75(b).

Section.Text: A request to the Tribunal to reconsider, under paragraph 91(1)(g) of the Special Import Measures Act, an order or finding made by it in an inquiry referred to in paragraph 90(c) of that Act must be filed with the Tribunal and must set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address for service, telephone number and fax number, if any, of the person making the request and of the person’s counsel, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nature of the person’s interest in the order or finding;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds on which the person believes reconsideration of the order or finding is warranted and a statement of the facts on which the grounds are based; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the nature of the action that the person believes the Tribunal should take pursuant to paragraph 91(3)(a) of that Act on completion of the reconsideration.

Section.Text: If the Tribunal decides, on its own initiative or on request, to reconsider an order or finding under paragraph 91(1)(g) of the Special Import Measures Act, it must without delay cause to be published in the Canada Gazette a notice of reconsideration setting out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statutory authority for the reconsideration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the matter or thing that is the subject of the reconsideration;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which any written submission must be filed with the Tribunal and the number of copies of the written submission that must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: instructions with respect to the filing of confidential information;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the Tribunal has or has not directed that a hearing be held;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the Tribunal has directed that a hearing be held, the following information, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the place and time fixed for commencement of the hearing or, if the place and time have not been fixed, a statement that notice of the place and time fixed for the hearing will be given to any person who files with the Tribunal a written request for such a notice,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on or before which any person interested in the matter or thing must file with the Tribunal a notice of participation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on or before which counsel for a person who files a notice of participation must file with the Tribunal a notice of representation and, if appropriate, a declaration and undertaking referred to in subrule 16(1);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the address to which written submissions or correspondence may be sent or delivered and at which information in respect of the reconsideration may be obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that is relevant to the reconsideration.

Section.Text: The Tribunal shall send a copy of the notice of reconsideration referred to in Rule 78 to the following persons and governments:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where reconsideration of the order or finding referred to in that rule was initiated by the Tribunal at the request of a person interested, the person interested;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the President;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: each domestic producer of goods that are like the goods to which the order or finding applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all parties to the inquiry in which the order or finding was made and governments to which notice of the making of the order or finding was given by the Tribunal.

Heading.TitleText: Forwarding of Notice of Action Taken and Reasons

Section.Text: In addition to the persons referred to in paragraph 91(3)(b) of the Special Import Measures Act, the Tribunal shall forward by registered mail the notice of action taken and copies of the reasons for that action referred to in that paragraph to every other person to whom and government to which the Tribunal was required by rule 79 to send a copy of a Notice of Reconsideration.

Rules 59 and 60 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, to a request for a ruling that is referred to in subsection 89(1) of the Special Import Measures Act and any re-hearing in connection with a reconsideration by the Tribunal under paragraph 91(1)(g) of that Act.

This Part applies in respect of a written complaint filed with the Tribunal under subsection 23(1), (1.01), (1.02), (1.03), (1.04), (1.05), (1.06), (1.061), (1.07), (1.08), (1.081), (1.09), (1.091), (1.092), (1.093), (1.094), (1.095), (1.096), (1.097), (1.098) or (1.1) of the Act by a domestic producer of goods that are like or directly competitive with goods being imported into Canada, or by a person or an association acting on behalf of such a domestic producer.

Heading.TitleText: Additional Information Accompanying a Written Complaint

Subsection.Text: In addition to providing the information set out in subsections 23(2) and (3) of the Act, a complaint filed with the Tribunal shall be signed by the complainant or by the complainant’s counsel, if any, and shall be accompanied by the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address for service, telephone number and fax number, if any, of the complainant and of the complainant’s counsel, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name and description of the imported goods concerned, their tariff classification, their current tariff treatment, and the name and description of the like or directly competitive domestic goods concerned;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: the locations of the establishments in which the complainant produces the domestic goods;

Paragraph.Label: (a.3)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of domestic production of the like or directly competitive goods that the complainant accounts for and the basis for claiming that the complainant is representative of an industry;

Paragraph.Label: (a.4)
Paragraph.Text: the names and locations of all other domestic establishments in which the like or directly competitive goods are produced;

Paragraph.Label: (a.5)
Paragraph.Text: data on total domestic production of the like or directly competitive goods for each of the five most recent full years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of any documents that may be useful in explaining or supporting the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of any other interested parties;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the actual volume of the goods imported into Canada for each of the five most recent full years that form the basis of the complaint and the effect of the imported goods on the prices of like or directly competitive goods in Canada, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: whether there has been a significant increase in the importation into Canada of the goods, either absolutely or relative to the production in Canada of like or directly competitive goods,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the prices of the goods imported into Canada have significantly undercut the prices of like or directly competitive goods produced and sold in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: whether the effect of the importation into Canada of the goods has been

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: to depress significantly the prices of like or directly competitive goods produced and sold in Canada, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: to limit to a significant degree increases in the prices of like or directly competitive goods produced and sold in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the impact of the imported goods on domestic producers of like or directly competitive goods in Canada and all relevant economic factors and indices that have a bearing on the industry that comprises or includes the like or directly competitive goods, including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: actual and potential changes in the level of production, employment, sales, market share, profits and losses, productivity, return on investments, utilization of production capacity, cash flow, inventories, wages, growth or ability to raise capital or investments, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: factors affecting domestic prices.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the information specified in subrule (1), information that is necessary to apply the factors set out in subsection 4(1) or (1.1) of the Canadian International Trade Tribunal Regulations shall be filed at the request of the Tribunal.

Section.Text: This Part applies to a reference made to the Tribunal

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pursuant to section 18 of the Act, for inquiry into and report to the Governor in Council on any matter in relation to the economic, trade or commercial interests of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pursuant to section 19 of the Act, for inquiry into and report to the Minister on any tariff-related matter, except a matter referred to in Part X;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pursuant to section 19.01, 19.011, 19.012, 19.0121, 19.013, 19.0131, 19.014, 19.015, 19.016, 19.017, 19.018, 19.019, 19.0191, 19.0192 or 19.1 of the Act, for inquiry into and report to the Governor in Council on any matter in relation to the importation of goods that are entitled, under the Customs Tariff, to the United States Tariff, the Mexico Tariff, the Mexico-United States Tariff, the Canada-Israel Free Trade Agreement Tariff, the Chile Tariff, the Columbia Tariff, the Costa Rica Tariff, the Panama Tariff, the Iceland Tariff, the Norway Tariff, the Switzerland-Liechtenstein Tariff, the Peru Tariff, the Jordan Tariff, the Honduras Tariff, the Korea Tariff or the Ukraine Tariff; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pursuant to section 20 of the Act, for inquiry into and report to the Governor in Council on any matter in relation to the importation of goods or to the provision by persons normally resident outside Canada of services in Canada.

Section.Text: If under section 18, 19, 19.01, 19.011, 19.012, 19.0121, 19.013, 19.0131, 19.014, 19.015, 19.016, 19.017, 19.018, 19.019, 19.0191, 19.0192, 19.1 or 20 of the Act, a matter is referred to the Tribunal for inquiry and report, the Tribunal must cause to be published in the Canada Gazette a notice of inquiry setting out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statutory authority for the inquiry;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the complainant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the imported goods that are the subject of the inquiry, including their tariff classification;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which any written submission must be filed with the Tribunal and the number of copies of any written submission that must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: instructions with respect to the filing of confidential information;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the Tribunal has or has not directed that a hearing be held;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the Tribunal has directed that a hearing be held, the following information, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the place and time fixed for commencement of the hearing or, if the place and time have not been fixed, a statement that notice of the place and time fixed for the hearing will be given to any person who files with the Tribunal a written request for such a notice,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on or before which any person interested in the matter must file with the Tribunal a notice of participation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on or before which counsel for a person who files a notice of participation must file with the Tribunal a notice of representation and, if appropriate, a declaration and undertaking referred to in subrule 16(1);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the address to which written submissions or correspondence may be sent or delivered and at which information in respect of the inquiry may be obtained and non-confidential documents filed in the course of the inquiry may be inspected, as well as the name, address and telephone number of the office to be contacted for more information; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that is relevant to the inquiry.

Section.Text: The Tribunal shall send a copy of a notice of inquiry referred to in rule 85 to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the inquiry is in relation to goods, all domestic producers, importers into Canada and exporters to Canada of such goods who are known to the Tribunal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the inquiry is in relation to the provision of services, all persons who provide the services in Canada who are known to the Tribunal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the government of any country that is considered by the Tribunal to have an interest in the inquiry; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any trade association that appears to the Tribunal to have a particular interest in the inquiry.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding that a notice of inquiry referred to in rule 85 states that the Tribunal has not directed that a hearing be held, the Tribunal may, at any time after publication of the notice in the Canada Gazette, direct that a hearing be held if, at any time after that publication, it considers that the holding of a hearing is necessary or desirable.
If, under subrule (1), the Tribunal directs that a hearing be held, it must cause to be published in the Canada Gazette a notice setting out that it has so directed.
Any notice given pursuant to subrule (2) shall include the information set out in paragraph 78(f).

Section.Text: Rules 59 and 60 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, to an inquiry conducted by the Tribunal in connection with a standing reference to which this Part applies.

Heading.Label: PART X
Heading.TitleText: References Under Section 19 and Reviews Under Section 19.02 of the Act

Section.Text: This Part applies in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a standing reference made to the Tribunal under section 19 of the Act by the Minister for inquiry and report into

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any written complaint made to the Tribunal by a domestic producer of goods alleging that like or directly competitive goods that originate in a country designated in the List of Countries set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff as a beneficiary of the General Preferential Tariff and that are being imported into Canada at the General Preferential Tariff rates of customs duty under section 33 of the Customs Tariff, or that originate in a country designated in the List of Countries set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff as a beneficiary of the Least Developed Country Tariff and that are being imported into Canada at the Least Developed Country Tariff rates of customs duty under section 37 of the Customs Tariff, are causing or threatening injury to that producer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any written complaint made to the Tribunal by a domestic producer of goods alleging that like or directly competitive goods that originate in a country designated in the List of Countries set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff as a beneficiary of the Commonwealth Caribbean Countries Tariff and that are being imported into Canada at the Commonwealth Caribbean Countries Tariff rates of customs duty under section 41 of the Customs Tariff, are causing or threatening injury to that producer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a review made under section 19.02 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: A written complaint by a domestic producer referred to in paragraph 89(a) shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: signed by the complainant or by the complainant’s counsel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: accompanied by the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the facts on which the allegations are based,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the nature of the relief sought,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the goods in issue,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the sources from which the goods are being imported at preferential rates,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address for service, telephone number and fax number, if any, of the complainant and of the complainant’s counsel, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of any documents that may be useful in explaining or supporting the complaint,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of any other domestic producers of the goods referred to in the complaint, indicating which, if any, of those producers support the complaint,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 83(d) and (e), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: such other information as is available to the complainant to prove the facts referred to in subparagraph (i).

Subsection.Text: If the Tribunal determines that the information provided by the complainant and any other information examined by the Tribunal discloses a reasonable indication that the domestic producer has suffered, or may suffer, injury as a result of imports occurring or that might occur under the tariff preferences referred to in paragraph 89(a), the Tribunal shall commence an inquiry into the complaint.

Section.Text: If a temporary safeguard measure that has been implemented by the Government of Canada to prevent or remedy the injury caused to domestic producers by imports under the tariff preferences referred to in paragraph 89(a) is scheduled to expire, the Tribunal must, in order for it to receive and review written submissions that may be made by interested parties in relation to the future status of the measure, cause to be published in the Canada Gazette, not later than 10 months before the measure is scheduled to expire, a notice of expiry that sets out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the measure is scheduled to expire;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the statutory authority for the review of the measure;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which any written submissions must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address to which written submissions or correspondence may be sent or delivered and at which information in respect of the review of the measure may be obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that is relevant to the measure.

Section.Text: Rules 59, 60 and 85 to 87 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, to an inquiry conducted by the Tribunal in connection with a standing reference to which this Part applies.

Heading.TitleText: Notice of Review Under Section 19.02 of the Act

Section.Text: If the Tribunal is required to conduct a mid-term review under section 19.02 of the Act, it must cause to be published in the Canada Gazette, not later than five months before the review, a notice of review that sets out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statutory authority for the review of the safeguard measure;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the mid-point of the safeguard measure to be reviewed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the subject-matter of the review;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which a notice of participation or any written submissions must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the Tribunal for the filing or service of documents and where information in respect of the review may be obtained; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the Tribunal considers relevant to the review.

Heading.TitleText: Sending of Notice of Mid-term Review

Section.Text: The Tribunal must send a copy of the notice of mid-term review referred to in rule 92.1 to other interested parties.

A mid-term review referred to in rule 92.1 shall be decided on the basis of a hearing by way of written submissions unless the Tribunal, on its own initiative or on the written request of a party, decides to proceed by way of a hearing at which the parties or their counsel appear before the Tribunal or by way of an electronic hearing.
Rules 59 and 60 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, to a review referred to in rule 92.1.

Heading.Label: PART XI
Heading.TitleText: Inquiries into Procurement Complaints by Potential Suppliers

Section.Text: In this Part working day means a day that is not a Saturday or a holiday.
This Part applies in respect of inquiries into complaints filed with the Tribunal by potential suppliers under subsection 30.11(1) of the Act.
In this Part where anything is to be done within eight days or less, any day within that period that is not a working day shall not be counted.

Subsection.Text: A complaint shall be considered to have been filed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the day it was received by the Tribunal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a complaint that does not comply with subsection 30.11(2) of the Act, on the day that the Tribunal receives the information that corrects the deficiencies in order that the complaint comply with that subsection.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subrule (1), the day of receipt is the day stamped on the complaint or on the document containing the information that corrects the deficiencies.

Section.Text: If the Tribunal decides to conduct an inquiry under subsection 30.13(1) of the Act, it must, without delay send a copy of the complaint to the government institution.

Heading.TitleText: Notice of Decision Not To Inquire

Section.Text: If the Tribunal decides not to conduct an inquiry for reasons other than those set out in subsection 30.13(5) of the Act, it must without delay notify, in writing, the complainant, the relevant government institution and any other party that the Tribunal considers to be an interested party.
If a designated contract that is the subject of a complaint has been awarded, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the government institution must, without delay upon being notified of the complaint, file with the Tribunal in writing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and postal and email addresses of the contractor to whom the designated contract was awarded, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if known by the government institution, the name of a representative of the contractor; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Tribunal must, without delay after receipt of the information, send the contractor a copy of all the information provided to the Tribunal as part of the complaint that has not been designated as confidential under section 46 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subrule 107(5), the government institution must, not later than 25 days after the first working day following the receipt of a copy of the complaint referred to in rule 100, file with the Tribunal a report containing a copy of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the solicitation, including the specifications or portions of it that are relevant to the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all other documents that are relevant to the complaint;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that sets out all findings, actions and recommendations of the government institution and that responds fully to all allegations that are contained in the complaint; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any additional evidence or information that may be necessary to resolve the complaint.

Subsection.Text: A copy of the complaint is considered to be received by a government institution only when the government institution is in receipt of all of the documents contained in the complaint, including all documents that contain confidential information.

Section.Text: Subject to subrule 107(5), the complainant must, within seven days after receipt of a copy of the report referred to in subrule 103(1), file with the Tribunal any comments on the report or make a written request to have the case decided on the basis of the existing record.

Subsection.Text: A party to a complaint may make a written request to the Tribunal for an extension of a time limit set out in this Part. The party must set out in the request the reasons for the extension and notify all other parties of the request.
The Tribunal must determine, in writing, whether the circumstances of the complaint warrant granting the extension and, if appropriate, must fix a new time limit.
If the Tribunal, on its own initiative, considers that the circumstances of a complaint warrant the extension of a time limit set out in this Part, the Tribunal must fix a new limit in writing.

The Tribunal may, in respect of the merits of a complaint or any matter that is relevant to the consideration of the complaint and on the written request of a party or on its own initiative, hold an electronic hearing or a hearing at which the parties or their counsel appear in person before the Tribunal.
A request for a hearing must be submitted as soon as possible during the course of the proceeding.
The Tribunal must set a date, time and place for the hearing and notify the parties of them.
The Tribunal must give notice to the parties of the subject-matter of the hearing.

If the complainant or the government institution requests an expeditious determination of a complaint, the Tribunal must consider the feasibility of using the express option procedure set out in subrule (5).
The Tribunal may apply the express option in the case of any complaint that is suitable for resolution within 45 days.
A request for the express option must be made in writing and submitted to the Tribunal without delay.
The Tribunal must determine whether or not to apply the express option and must notify the complainant, the government institution and any interveners of the determination.
Where the express option is applied, the time limits set out in this Part for filing documents shall not apply and the following procedure shall be followed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the government institution must, within 10 working days after the day on which it is notified by the Tribunal that the express option is to be applied, file with the Tribunal a report on the complaint containing the documents referred to in subrule 103(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the complainant must, within five days after receipt of a copy of the report, file with the Tribunal comments on the report or make a written request to have the case to be decided on the basis of the existing record;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Tribunal shall issue a determination on the complaint within 45 days after determining that the express option will be applied.

Heading.Label: PART XII
Heading.TitleText: Extension Inquiries Under Section 30.07 of the Act

Section.Text: This Part applies in respect of an extension inquiry under section 30.07 of the Act.

If the Tribunal is required to publish a notice of expiry under subsection 30.03(1) of the Act in respect of an order referred to in that subsection, the notice shall be published in the Canada Gazette not later than eight months before the expiry date and shall set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the order is scheduled to expire;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which written submissions must be filed by interested parties requesting or opposing an extension inquiry;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the Tribunal for the filing or service of documents and where information in respect of the extension inquiry may be obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number of copies of each written submission that must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: instructions in respect of the filing of confidential information; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any other relevant information that the Tribunal may require.

Section.Text: A request for an extension inquiry filed with the Tribunal shall be signed by the requester or by their counsel, if any, and, in addition to providing the information required by section 30.05 of the Act, shall be accompanied by the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone and fax numbers, if any, of the requester or their counsel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and description of the imported goods and the like or directly competitive goods;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names of the domestic producers on whose behalf the request is being made and the proportion of total domestic production of like or directly competitive goods that is produced by them;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any information that is necessary to address the matters raised in subsection 4(1) and section 6 or 7 of the Canadian International Trade Tribunal Regulations and subsection 30.03(2) of the Act, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating why the order that is the subject of the extension inquiry continues to be necessary to prevent or remedy serious injury to domestic producers of like or directly competitive goods.

Section.Text: If a notice is provided under subsection 30.06(3) of the Act, the Tribunal shall give the other interested parties referred to in that subsection an opportunity to make representations to the Tribunal concerning the request referred to in rule 111.
If the Tribunal commences an extension inquiry, the notice published under subsection 30.07(2) of the Act shall set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statutory authority for the extension inquiry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the subject-matter of the extension inquiry, together with any other relevant details of the extension inquiry that the Tribunal directs;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which an other interested party must file a notice of participation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which counsel for an interested party must file a notice of representation and, if appropriate, a declaration and undertaking referred to in subrule 16(1);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date on or before which written submissions must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number of copies of each written submission that must be filed;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: instructions with respect to the filing of confidential information;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the Tribunal to which written submissions or correspondence may be sent or delivered and at which information in respect of the extension inquiry may be obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the place and time fixed for the commencement of a hearing in the extension inquiry; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the Tribunal considers relevant to the extension inquiry.

Section.Text: Rules 59 and 60 apply, with any modifications that the circumstances require, in respect of an extension inquiry conducted by the Tribunal under this Part.
